section.title: Tutorial1: Browsing FlyMine: Running a quick search
section.para: This tutorial will guide you through running a quick search. The tutorial will show you how to run a quick search for the 'zen' gene.
The quick search allows you to access all the information that is available for a particular database entry and provides a good way to browse the database.
The quick search option is accessed from the main query page. (To access the main query page click on 'Start a query' in the FlyMine home page).
Enter the gene symbol 'zen' into the search box and press 'Search':

Since one item in the database matches the term 'zen', you will be taken straight to the 'Object Details' page for the 'zen' gene. Navigating the object details page is described in more detail in tutorial3

Wild cards (*) can be added to increase the range of a quick search. Enter 'zen*' into the search box and press 'Search'. This time the search term matches several items in the database and a summary list of these will be returned as your results. Each summary includes a link ('details') to the object details page for that item:
